title: Jahan Records Khatam Ho Jaate Hain
description: The investigation into the 45 kg classified sample, 'Type R-9', leads the team out of the abandoned railway yard and towards a highly secretive, decommissioned research facility.
previousSummary: Jahan records khatam ho jaate hain, wahan personal diaries sach bolti hain. Ek purani factory ke andar, ek hawa band kamre mein, humein ek military-grade rivet aur ek paper slip mila. Slip par teen cheezein thi: 1974 ki tareekh, 45 kilograms wajan, aur ek destination code: 'Yard 7-Delta.' Yeh code ek aise railway freight yard ke hisse ka tha jo 1980s mein permanently band kar diya gaya tha. Yard mein, ek purane signal cabin ke andar, humein ek chota, band dibba mila jismein ek inventory slip thi. Slip par wohi tareekh aur wajan (45 kg) tha, lekin is baar uske aage likha tha: 'Contents: Classified Sample - Type R-9.'
script:
Yeh inventory slip, jo 1974 ki tareekh rakhti thi, sirf wajan aur classified sample ka naam hi nahi bata rahi thi. Corner mein, ek behad halka, rubber stamp ka nishaan tha. Yeh nishaan itna dhundla tha ki pehli nazar mein yeh sirf kagaz ki ghisawat lag raha tha.

Lekin high-resolution imaging se pata chala ki yeh koi location code nahi tha. Yeh ek administrative designation thi. Teen aksharon ka code: 'K-47.' Records ke mutaabik, K-47 ek aisa designation tha jiska koi official reference public domain mein maujood nahi tha. Yeh ek aisa darwaza tha jo sirf andar se khulta tha.

K-47 ko cross-reference karne ke liye humein defense expenditure reports aur 1970s ke declassified budget documents ki gehri jaanch karni padi. Aur wahan, ek footnote mein, humein is designation ka zikr mila. K-47 Project ka zikr ek 'High-Altitude Material Science Research Facility' ke saath joda gaya tha. Location: Himalayan foothills mein ek remote area, jise 'Shikhar Base' ke naam se jaana jaata tha.

Shikhar Base tak ka safar aasan nahi tha. Yeh facility 1980s ke aakhir mein achanak band kar di gayi thi. Official records ke mutaabik, yeh 'budgetary reasons' ki wajah se hua tha. Lekin iski suraksha, iske perimeter ki deewaron ki unchai, aur iske band hone ki raftaar kuch aur hi ishara kar rahi thi. Hum wahan pahunche jahan sarak khatam ho jaati thi.

Base ka main gate zang kha chuka tha, lekin uski mazbooti ab bhi barkarar thi. Hum andar nahi ja sakte the. Lekin gate ke theek bahar, jahan freight trucks unload hote the, wahan zameen mein dhasaa hua, ek chota sa, zang laga hua metal tag mila. Yeh wohi tarah ka tag tha jo heavy cargo ko label karne ke liye istemaal hota tha.

Jab humne us tag ko saaf kiya, toh us par wohi adhoora serial number likha tha jo humein factory mein mile stencil par mila tha. Aur uske neeche, ek chota sa, haath se likha hua nishaan tha: 'R-9 Received. 45 KG.' Jahan records khatam ho jaate hain, wahan yeh chote tukde hamein batate hain ki woh 45 kilo ka sample, 1974 mein, apni aakhri manzil tak pahunch chuka tha. Sawal ab yeh nahi tha ki woh kahan gaya, balki yeh tha ki uske saath wahan kya hua.
